page.title: 02 CHANGING TIMES
page.content: 1891 was when Mrs Ross' house was built.Fields were ploughed with horses and a single furrow. Roads were dusty and they had big stones.Carts were pulled with one horse.They planted turnips,potatoes and corn,and they had barbed wire round the fields even then. People still use the mart the way they do now.They had quite a few windmills to grind the corn.They ate oatmeal,milk, potatoes and berries in the summer.You could only burn peat and wood because they couldn't get coal.For light,candles and paraffin lamps were used.You would have to get up at 5:00am to feed the cattle and the horses.Farms had over 10 chickens in those days and also pigs.
